questions.question: A maximum of 2 fielders are allowed behind square on the leg side.
In ODI cricket, only 5 fielders are allowed outside the 30-yard circle during non-powerplay overs.
A fielder can catch the ball after it crosses the boundary rope if they jump from inside the field.
The wicket-keeper must remain behind the stumps until the ball is bowled.
A fielder can run out a batsman if the ball deflects off their body onto the stumps.
In T20 cricket, only 5 fielders are allowed outside the circle after the powerplay.
A substitute fielder can take catches but cannot bowl or bat.
Close fielders are required to wear helmets when fielding within 15 yards of the bat.
A fielder can be positioned anywhere on the field except directly behind the batsman on strike.
The captain can change field positions between each ball of an over.
